intro: Sinapis brassicata, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and thrives in disturbed soils. Its seeds are small, oval, and often contain glucosinolates, which are defensive compounds. Field mustard is native to Europe but has been naturalized in many parts of the world.
